com.vernalis.pdbconnector2.dialogcomponents.swing

Class CountClearButtonBox

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.Box
            • com.vernalis.pdbconnector2.dialogcomponents.swing.CountClearButtonBox
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.event.ChangeListener

    public class CountClearButtonBox
extends javax.swing.Box
implements javax.swing.event.ChangeListener
    A box to add 'Count' and 'Clear' buttons to a QueryPanel The buttons are laid out horizontally (the default) or vertically, with a 5 pixel spacer around and between them.

    The 'Clear' button should clear the query in the container panel

    The 'Count' button should only be enabled when there is a query. Clicking the button should count the hits for the query panel, and disable the button until the query changes. If there is an error in the query, then the text 'Error!' will be displayed and the button again disabled until the query is changed

    Since:
    1.28.0
    Author:
    S.Roughley knime@vernalis.com
    See Also:
    Serialized Form
